documentation: Amazon WorkLink is a cloud-based service that provides secure access to internal websites and web apps from iOS phones. In a single step, your users, such as employees, can access internal websites as efficiently as they access any other public website. They enter a URL in their web browser, or choose a link to an internal website in an email. Amazon WorkLink authenticates the user's access and securely renders authorized internal web content in a secure rendering service in the AWS cloud. Amazon WorkLink doesn't download or store any internal web content on mobile devices.

AssociateDomain.documentation: Specifies a domain to be associated to Amazon WorkLink.
AssociateDomain.name: AssociateDomain

AssociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider.documentation: Associates a website authorization provider with a specified fleet. This is used to authorize users against associated websites in the company network.
AssociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider.name: AssociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider

AssociateWebsiteCertificateAuthority.documentation: Imports the root certificate of a certificate authority (CA) used to obtain TLS certificates used by associated websites within the company network.
AssociateWebsiteCertificateAuthority.name: AssociateWebsiteCertificateAuthority

CreateFleet.documentation: Creates a fleet. A fleet consists of resources and the configuration that delivers associated websites to authorized users who download and set up the Amazon WorkLink app.
CreateFleet.name: CreateFleet

DeleteFleet.documentation: Deletes a fleet. Prevents users from accessing previously associated websites.
DeleteFleet.name: DeleteFleet

DescribeAuditStreamConfiguration.documentation: Describes the configuration for delivering audit streams to the customer account.
DescribeAuditStreamConfiguration.name: DescribeAuditStreamConfiguration

DescribeCompanyNetworkConfiguration.documentation: Describes the networking configuration to access the internal websites associated with the specified fleet.
DescribeCompanyNetworkConfiguration.name: DescribeCompanyNetworkConfiguration

DescribeDevicePolicyConfiguration.documentation: Describes the device policy configuration for the specified fleet.
DescribeDevicePolicyConfiguration.name: DescribeDevicePolicyConfiguration

DescribeFleetMetadata.documentation: Provides basic information for the specified fleet, excluding identity provider, networking, and device configuration details.
DescribeFleetMetadata.name: DescribeFleetMetadata

DescribeIdentityProviderConfiguration.documentation: Describes the identity provider configuration of the specified fleet.
DescribeIdentityProviderConfiguration.name: DescribeIdentityProviderConfiguration

DisassociateDomain.documentation: Disassociates a domain from Amazon WorkLink. End users lose the ability to access the domain with Amazon WorkLink.
DisassociateDomain.name: DisassociateDomain

DisassociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider.documentation: Disassociates a website authorization provider from a specified fleet. After the disassociation, users can't load any associated websites that require this authorization provider.
DisassociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider.name: DisassociateWebsiteAuthorizationProvider

ListDevices.documentation: Retrieves a list of devices registered with the specified fleet.
ListDevices.name: ListDevices

ListDomains.documentation: Retrieves a list of domains associated to a specified fleet.
ListDomains.name: ListDomains

ListFleets.documentation: Retrieves a list of fleets for the current account and Region.
ListFleets.name: ListFleets

ListWebsiteAuthorizationProviders.documentation: Retrieves a list of website authorization providers associated with a specified fleet.
ListWebsiteAuthorizationProviders.name: ListWebsiteAuthorizationProviders

ListWebsiteCertificateAuthorities.documentation: Retrieves a list of certificate authorities added for the current account and Region.
ListWebsiteCertificateAuthorities.name: ListWebsiteCertificateAuthorities

RestoreDomainAccess.documentation: Moves a domain to ACTIVE status if it was in the INACTIVE status.
RestoreDomainAccess.name: RestoreDomainAccess

RevokeDomainAccess.documentation: Moves a domain to INACTIVE status if it was in the ACTIVE status.
RevokeDomainAccess.name: RevokeDomainAccess

SignOutUser.documentation: Signs the user out from all of their devices. The user can sign in again if they have valid credentials.
SignOutUser.name: SignOutUser

UpdateAuditStreamConfiguration.documentation: Updates the audit stream configuration for the fleet.
UpdateAuditStreamConfiguration.name: UpdateAuditStreamConfiguration

UpdateCompanyNetworkConfiguration.documentation: Updates the company network configuration for the fleet.
UpdateCompanyNetworkConfiguration.name: UpdateCompanyNetworkConfiguration

UpdateDevicePolicyConfiguration.documentation: Updates the device policy configuration for the fleet.
UpdateDevicePolicyConfiguration.name: UpdateDevicePolicyConfiguration

UpdateIdentityProviderConfiguration.documentation: Updates the identity provider configuration for the fleet.
UpdateIdentityProviderConfiguration.name: UpdateIdentityProviderConfiguration

AcmCertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of an issued ACM certificate that is valid for the domain being associated.

FleetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the fleet.

DomainName.documentation: The domain name of the authorization provider. This applies only to SAML-based authorization providers.

AuthorizationProviderId.documentation: A unique identifier for the authorization provider.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.documentation: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

AuditStreamArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis data stream that will receive the audit events.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The security groups associated with access to the provided subnets.

SubnetIds.documentation: The subnets used for X-ENI connections from Amazon WorkLink rendering containers.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC with connectivity to associated websites.

DeviceCaCertificate.documentation: The certificate chain, including intermediate certificates and the root certificate authority certificate used to issue device certificates.

DeviceId.documentation: A unique identifier for a registered user's device.

FirstAccessedTime.documentation: The date that the device first signed in to Amazon WorkLink.

LastAccessedTime.documentation: The date that the device last accessed Amazon WorkLink.

OperatingSystemVersion.documentation: The operating system version of the device.

PatchLevel.documentation: The operating system patch level of the device.

Username.documentation: The user name associated with the device.

AcmCertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of an issued ACM certificate that is valid for the domain being associated.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the domain was added.

CompanyCode.documentation: The identifier used by users to sign in to the Amazon WorkLink app.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the fleet was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time that the fleet was last updated.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.documentation: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

IdentityProviderSamlMetadata.documentation: The SAML metadata document provided by the user’s identity provider.

ServiceProviderSamlMetadata.documentation: The SAML metadata document uploaded to the user’s identity provider.

WebsiteCaId.documentation: A unique identifier for the certificate authority.

Certificate.documentation: The root certificate of the certificate authority.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the certificate authority was added.

AuthorizationProviderId.documentation: A unique identifier for the authorization provider.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time that the domain was created.

CompanyCode.documentation: The identifier used by users to sign into the Amazon WorkLink app.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time when the fleet was created.

LastUpdatedTime.documentation: The time when the fleet was last updated.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to be included in the next page.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the limit.

UnauthorizedException.documentation: You are not authorized to perform this action.

AuditStreamArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis data stream that receives the audit events.

SecurityGroupIds.documentation: The security groups associated with access to the provided subnets.

SubnetIds.documentation: The subnets used for X-ENI connections from Amazon WorkLink rendering containers.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC with connectivity to associated websites.

DeviceCaCertificate.documentation: The certificate chain, including intermediate certificates and the root certificate authority certificate used to issue device certificates.

DisplayName.documentation: The fleet name to display. The existing DisplayName is unset if null is passed.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.documentation: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

IdentityProviderSamlMetadata.documentation: The SAML metadata document provided by the customer’s identity provider. The existing IdentityProviderSamlMetadata is unset if null is passed.

WebsiteAuthorizationProviderSummary.documentation: The summary of the website authorization provider.

AuthorizationProviderId.documentation: A unique identifier for the authorization provider.

DomainName.documentation: The domain name of the authorization provider. This applies only to SAML-based authorization providers.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time when the CA was added.
